protocol_name: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
description:
A protocol for quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array.

MicroRNAs are purified from platelet-poor plasma using Nucleospin columns

During the purification step samples are spiked with cel-miR-39 as a mean of technical normalization

Normalization is performed using the ΔCt-method
before_start:
We recommend to test if the volume of spike-in added during microRNA purification is adequate before purifing all your samples.

When testing the preamplification product, the Ct-values of the spike-in and the target miRNA should be within the same range, otherwise adjust the volume of spike-in added during miRNA purification.

guidelines:
Blood samples should be obtained using a minimum of venous stasis and with discard of the first 3 mL of blood.

Platelet-poor plasma should be prepared within 2 hours from blood sampling
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Dual centrifugation

  1. use 10 ml of EDTA anticoagulated whole blood
  2. centrifugation at 3000 g for 15 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)
  3. transfer plasma phase to new tube, leaving approximately 1 mL of plasma on top of the buffy coat
  4. centrifugation at 3000 g for 15 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)
  5. transfer plasma phase to cryo tubes, leaving approximately 1 ml of plasma in the bottom of the tube
  6. store at -80 °C
components.name: Description

source_data.protocol_name: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.annotation:
Alternatively, a prolonged single centrifugation may be used

1. use 5 ml of EDTA anticoagulated whole blood

2. centrifuge at 3000 g for 30 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)

3. transfer plasma phase to cryo-tubes, leaving approximately 0.5 ml of plasma on top of the buffy coat
source_data.thread_text:

2. centrifuge at 3000 g for 30 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)

3. transfer plasma phase to cryo-tubes, leaving approximately 0.5 ml of plasma on top of the buffy coat

source_data.protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.annotation:
STEP 1: use 300 µL platelet-poor plasma

STEP 4: after addition of isopropanol, add also 5 µL spike-in (cel-miR-39, 2.75 × 10−12 M)

STEP 6: perform the optional DNA digest

components.data:
Prepare RT master mix:

 

Component

Master mix volume per

10 µL reaction*
Customs RT primer pool (10X) 1 µL
100 mM dNTPs (with dTTP) 0.27 µL
Multiscribe RT enzyme (50 U/µL) 2 µL
10x RT buffer 1 µL
MgCl2 (25 mM) 1 µL
RNase inhibitor (20 U/µL) 0.1 µL
Nuclease free water 1.63 µL

*add 10-20% excess volume

 

 

Mix gently and place on ice
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 5 of Quantification of circulating microRNA using single TaqMan assays
source_data.protocol_name: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.annotation:
Remember to include a RT-negative sample (no template)

It is also a good idea to include a RT-positive sample (a microRNA-sample included in all runs)
source_data.thread_text:
Remember to include a RT-negative sample (no template)

It is also a good idea to include a RT-positive sample (a microRNA-sample included in all runs)
source_data.body:

It is also a good idea to include a RT-positive sample (a microRNA-sample included in all runs)

components.data:
For each RT reaction, combine 7 µL RT master mix with 3 µL of purified microRNA in a 0.2 µL polypropylene reaction tube

 

Keep on ice
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each RT reaction, combine 7 µL RT master mix with 3 µL of purified microRNA in a 0.2 µL polypropylene reaction tube

 

Keep on ice

components.data: Mix gently and incubate on ice for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix gently and incubate on ice for 5 minutes

components.data:
Transfer the reaction tubes to a termocycler

Incubate in 40 cycles of 16 °C for 2 min, at 42 °C for 1 min and 50 °C for 1 sec.

Finish with 85 °C for 5 min and cool to 4 ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer the reaction tubes to a termocycler

Incubate in 40 cycles of 16 °C for 2 min, at 42 °C for 1 min and 50 °C for 1 sec.

Finish with 85 °C for 5 min and cool to 4 ºC.

components.data: Continue immediately to the PCR amplification or store the RT-reaction in -20 °C.
components.name: Description

components.data:
Prepare preamplification reaction mix:

 

Component Volume per 25 µL reaction*
2x TaqMan PreAmp master mix 12.5 µL
Customs Primers (10X) 2.5 µL
Nuclease free water 5 µL
Total volume 20 µL

*add 10-20% excess volume

 

Mix gently
components.name: Description

components.data:
Combine 20 µL of qPCR reaction mix with 5 µL of RT-reaction (cDNA) in a 96 well plate

Seal plate
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Combine 20 µL of qPCR reaction mix with 5 µL of RT-reaction (cDNA) in a 96 well plate

Seal plate

components.data:
Incubate in 95 °C for 10 min, 55 °C for 2 min and 72 °C for 2 min

Proceed with 14 cycles of 95 °C for 15 sec and 60 °C for 4 min.

Finish with 99.9 °C for 10 min and cool to 4 °C

 

Continue immediately or store at 4 °C for up to 12 hours or at -20 °C for up to 1 week.
components.name: Description

components.data: Use a specific TaqMan assay for the spike-in (Cel-miR-39, assay 000200) and one of the target miRNAs included in the Array to test the preamplification product before loading it on the array.

components.data:
Prepare qPCR reaction mix (run each sample in doublets):

 

Component Volume per 20.3 µL reaction*
2x TaqMan Universal PCR master mix 10 µL
20x TaqMan microRNA assay 1 µL
Nuclease free water 8 µL
Total volume 19 µL

*add 10-20% excess volume

 

Mix gently
components.name: Description

components.data:
Combine 19 µL of qPCR reaction mix with 1.3 µL of RT-reaction (cDNA) in a 96 well plate

Seal plate
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Combine 19 µL of qPCR reaction mix with 1.3 µL of RT-reaction (cDNA) in a 96 well plate

Seal plate

components.data:
Transfer plate to ABI Prism 7900HT

Use the SDS software to set up the run

Incubate in 50 °C for 2 min and 95 °C for 10 min

Proceed with 40 cycles of 95 °C for 15 sec and 60 °C for 60 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer plate to ABI Prism 7900HT

Use the SDS software to set up the run

Incubate in 50 °C for 2 min and 95 °C for 10 min

Proceed with 40 cycles of 95 °C for 15 sec and 60 °C for 60 sec.
Evaluate the Ct-values obtained

components.data:
Prepare samples:

 

Component Volume per 120 µL reaction
2x TaqMan Universal PCR II mix No AmpErase UNG 60 µL
PreAmplification product 1,2 µL
Nuclease free water 58,8 µL
Total volume 120 µL

components.data:
Load 100 µL sample-dilution to each port on the array

Centrifuge The array at 1200 rpm for 2 min

Seal the array
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Load 100 µL sample-dilution to each port on the array

Centrifuge The array at 1200 rpm for 2 min

Seal the array

components.data:
Normalization is performed using the ΔCt-method (2-ΔCt)

ΔCt = mean Cttarget miRNA - mean Ctcel-miR-39 (mean of triplets)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

components.data:
Transfer array to ABI Prism 7900HT

Use the SDS software to set up the run

Incubate in 50 °C for 2 min and 94.5 °C for 10 min

Proceed with 40 cycles of 97 °C for 30 sec and 59.7 °C for 60 sec.
